![Send.cr CI](https://img.shields.io/github/workflow/status/wyhaines/http2.cr/HTTP2%20CI?style=for-the-badge&logo=GitHub)
[![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/wyhaines/http2.cr.svg?style=for-the-badge)](https://github.com/wyhaines/http2.cr/releases)
![GitHub commits since latest release (by SemVer)](https://img.shields.io/github/commits-since/wyhaines/http2.cr/latest?style=for-the-badge)

# http2

WIP. This will be a pure HTTP/2 protocol implementation. It is the building blocks of HTTP/2 itself,
and lacks either a client or a server implementation in this shard.

Client and server implementations will be in separate shards that make use of this common shard.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     http2:
       github: your-github-user/http2
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "http2"
```

3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

def.body:
x = allocate
if x.responds_to?(:finalize)

def.name: serialize
def.body:
self.each do |name, values|
  values.each do |value|
    (((io << name) << ": ") << value) << "\r\n"
  end
end
io << "\r\n"
io

types.name: Frame
types.doc:
This is an abstract superclass for all HTTP/2 Frames. The reference specification
can be found at [https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7540#section-6](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7540#section-6).

A frame is a basic unit of data transmission in HTTP/2. Every frame has a type,
specified by an 8-bit type code, a stream identifier which indicates which stream the frame
belongs to, and a payload. Most Frame types also define a set of flags that differ based
on the type of the Frame. Specific Frame types may have other considerations, such as
padding length and padding bytes in Data frames, so consult the implementation and the
reference specification for more information.
types.summary: This is an abstract superclass for all HTTP/2 Frames.

constructors.name: from_io
constructors.args_string: (io : IO) : Frame

def.name: from_io
def.body:
length = ((io.read_bytes(UInt8)).to_u32 << 16) | (io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::NetworkEndian))
type = io.read_bytes(UInt8)
flags = Flags.new(io.read_bytes(UInt8))
stream_id = (io.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::NetworkEndian)) & 2147483647
payload = Bytes.new(length)
io.read_fully(payload)
(type(type)).new(flags, stream_id, payload)

def.name: new

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
This will output the frame in a wire compatible format. All frames are formatted
identically.

----------------------
|    Length (24)     |
----------------------
|      Type (8)      |
----------------------
|     Flags (8)      |
----------------------
|   Stream ID (31)   |
----------------------
| Payload (variable) |
----------------------
instance_methods.summary: This will output the frame in a wire compatible format.

else

instance_methods.name: error?
instance_methods.doc: This method may be overridden to do error checking on the frame, to determine if it might be invalid in some way.
instance_methods.summary: This method may be overridden to do error checking on the frame, to determine if it might be invalid in some way.

def.name: error?
def.body:
if stream_id == 0
  HTTP2::ProtocolError.new("DATA frame must have non-zero stream ID")
else
  if padded? && pad_length >= ((payload.size - data_offset) - pad_length)
    HTTP2::ProtocolError.new("PADDED flag is set, but pad length is greater than payload size")
  end
end

instance_methods.name: pad_length
instance_methods.doc: If the frame has padding enabled, this byte will contain the length of the padding
instance_methods.summary: If the frame has padding enabled, this byte will contain the length of the padding

def.name: padding
def.body:
if padded?
  (-1 * (pad_length + 1)) == -1 ? Bytes.empty : payload[(-1 * (pad_length))..(-1)]
else
  Bytes.empty
end

def.name: error?
def.body:
if stream_id == 0
  HTTP2::ProtocolError.new("Headers frame must have non-zero stream ID")
else
  if padded? && pad_length >= ((payload.size - data_offset) - pad_length)
    HTTP2::ProtocolError.new("PADDED flag is set, but pad length is greater than payload size")
  end
end

def.name: exclusive?
def.body:
if priority?
  payload[padding_offset].bits_set?(128)
else
  nil
end

def.name: stream_dependency
def.body:
if priority?
  (IO::ByteFormat::BigEndian.decode(UInt32, payload[padding_offset, 4])) & 2147483647
else
  nil
end

def.name: weight
def.body:
if priority?
  payload[padding_offset + 4].to_u8
else
  nil
end

instance_methods.name: error?
instance_methods.doc: This method may be overridden to do error checking on the frame, to determine if it might be invalid in some way.
instance_methods.summary: This method may be overridden to do error checking on the frame, to determine if it might be invalid in some way.

def.name: error?
def.body:
if stream_id != 0_u32
  HTTP2::ProtocolError.new("PING frame with non-zero stream ID")
else
  if data.size != 8
    HTTP2::FrameSizeError.new("PING frame with data size(#{data.size}) != 8")
  end
end

instance_methods.name: error?
instance_methods.doc: TODO: These checks are probably incomplete.
instance_methods.summary: TODO These checks are probably incomplete.

def.name: error?
def.body:
if stream_id == 0
  HTTP2::ProtocolError.new("SETTINGS frame must have non-zero stream ID")
else
  if (payload.size % 6) != 0
    HTTP2::FrameSizeError.new("SETTINGS frame payload must be a multiple of 6 octets in length")
  end
end

instance_methods.name: setup
instance_methods.doc:
This can be overridden in subclasses to do custom setup tasks without requiring overriding of
the default initialization methods.
instance_methods.summary: This can be overridden in subclasses to do custom setup tasks without requiring overriding of the default initialization methods.

def.name: setup
def.body:
@parameters = if error?
  ParameterHash.new
else
  params = ParameterHash.new(initial_capacity: payload.size // 6)
  position = 0
  while position < payload.size
    param = IO::ByteFormat::BigEndian.decode(UInt16, payload[position, 2])
    position = position + 2
    value = IO::ByteFormat::BigEndian.decode(UInt32, payload[position, 4])
    position = position + 4
    params[Parameters.from_value(param)] = value
  end
  params
end

types.name: ParameterHash
types.doc:
This holds the parameters that are parsed from a Settings frame payload,
and can also be used to provide parameters to a new Settings frame.
types.summary: This holds the parameters that are parsed from a Settings frame payload, and can also be used to provide parameters to a new Settings frame.

instance_methods.name: error?
instance_methods.doc: This method may be overridden to do error checking on the frame, to determine if it might be invalid in some way.
instance_methods.summary: This method may be overridden to do error checking on the frame, to determine if it might be invalid in some way.

def.name: error?
def.body:
if data.size != 4
  ProtocolError.new("WindowUpdate frame size error. A frame size of #{data.size} is invalid. A WindowUpdate frame must be 4 bytes long.")
else
  if (IO::ByteFormat::BigEndian.decode(UInt32, data)) == 0
    ProtocolError.new("WindowUpdate frame error. A WindowUpdate frame with a window size of 0 is invalid.")
  else
    false
  end
end
